description: Big Five personality trait narratives for PMERIT assessment results

high.narrative: You're curious and imaginative, drawn to new ideas and creative problem-solving. You thrive in environments that encourage innovation, exploration, and unconventional thinking.
high.careerFit: Roles requiring innovation, research, design, or strategic thinking

moderate.narrative: You balance practical thinking with openness to new ideas. You appreciate innovation but also value proven approaches, making you effective in roles requiring both creativity and consistency.
growthAreas: Could benefit from more creative exploration
moderate.careerFit: Roles blending established methods with opportunities for improvement

low.narrative: You prefer practical, tried-and-true approaches over abstract theories. You excel in roles with clear procedures and established methods, bringing consistency and reliability to your work.
growthAreas: Could benefit from exploring new approaches
low.careerFit: Roles with clear processes, quality control, or operational excellence

high.narrative: You're organized and dependable, with a strong sense of responsibility. You thrive in structured environments where planning, attention to detail, and follow-through matter.
high.careerFit: Roles requiring project management, compliance, quality assurance, or leadership

moderate.narrative: You balance organization with flexibility. You can plan ahead while adapting to changing circumstances, making you effective in dynamic environments.
moderate.careerFit: Roles requiring both structure and adaptability

low.narrative: You prefer flexibility over rigid structure. You work well in dynamic environments where adaptability matters more than detailed planning, bringing spontaneity and agility to your work.
low.careerFit: Roles in fast-paced, creative, or entrepreneurial environments

high.narrative: You're energized by social interaction and enjoy being around others. You thrive in collaborative, people-oriented environments where communication and networking are valued.
growthAreas: May need to develop independent work skills
high.careerFit: Roles in sales, marketing, leadership, or client-facing positions

moderate.narrative: You balance social engagement with independent focus. You're comfortable collaborating with teams yet equally effective working alone, adapting your energy to the situation.
growthAreas: May need to push for visibility in groups
moderate.careerFit: Roles requiring both teamwork and individual contribution

low.narrative: You prefer focused, independent work and meaningful one-on-one connections over large group settings. You excel in roles requiring deep concentration and thoughtful analysis.
growthAreas: May need to build networking comfort
low.careerFit: Roles in research, writing, analysis, or technical specialization

high.narrative: You're cooperative and empathetic, often seeking harmony in relationships. This helps you build trust and work effectively in team-oriented settings where collaboration matters.
high.careerFit: Roles in counseling, teaching, healthcare, HR, or team coordination

moderate.narrative: You balance cooperation with healthy assertiveness. You value team harmony while advocating for your own perspective when needed, making you effective in negotiation.
moderate.careerFit: Roles requiring both teamwork and individual advocacy

low.narrative: You're direct and prioritize results over social harmony. You excel in roles requiring tough decisions, objective analysis, and willingness to challenge the status quo.
growthAreas: May need to soften delivery in team settings
low.careerFit: Roles in management, law, analysis, or competitive environments

emotionalStability.name: Emotional Stability
emotionalStability.note: Displayed as inverse of Neuroticism (high stability = low neuroticism)

high.narrative: You handle stress well and maintain composure under pressure. Your emotional resilience makes you effective in high-stakes environments where calm leadership matters.
high.careerFit: Roles in leadership, crisis management, healthcare, or high-pressure environments

moderate.narrative: You handle stress reasonably well, though occasional ups and downs are part of your rhythm. Your self-awareness helps you recognize when to step back and recharge.
growthAreas: May benefit from stress management techniques
moderate.careerFit: Most roles with reasonable stress levels

low.narrative: You experience emotions intensely, which can fuel passion and creativity. Developing coping strategies can help channel this sensitivity productively into your work.
low.careerFit: Roles allowing emotional expression, creativity, or helping others
